newsitem.title: JAPAN: Chirac says needs of Zaire refugees unchanged.
newsitem.headline: Chirac says needs of Zaire refugees unchanged.

text.p: French President Jacques Chirac said on Tuesday that Paris still believed a multinational force was needed to help out with the refugee crisis in Zaire, even though many of the refugees were returning home to Rwanda.
Chirac, who is visiting Japan, told a news conference the force was still needed to protect airfields and food convoys.

Military officials from Canada, the United States, France and about a dozen other nations will meet in Germany on Thursday to reassess the rapidly changing need for a humanitarian relief force in Zaire, including possibly changing its mission or scaling back the force.

Asked whether France had any thought of modifying its position now that refugees were leaving, Chirac replied: "The French policy in the region has two objectives... These objectives have not changed.
"So no, the situation in the area has not changed. It (a multinational force) is necessary for the security of the airfields and food convoys."
